title: Chicken Paitan Soup
steps: Add the chicken parts and water to a pot.
Bring to a boil, then down to a simmer, and skim the scum that rises to the top. Do this for 15-20 minutes, or until little scum is rising.
Cook at a medium boil for 6 hours, stirring frequently, and adding water to ensure bones are covered.
Add aromatics, boil thoroughly for one hour.

To finalize the emulsion, add the soup to a blender and blend on high for 30 seconds, being careful to gradually bring the blender to high to avoid splashing. You can also use a hand blender for 5 minutes, though the emulsion won't be as strong.
notes: A simpler approach for making a creamy soup at home.
Full-bodied and rich in chicken flavor.
Can be made in pressure cooker: 45 minutes at pressure (or 30 minutes with 30-minute natural release).
Can be stored for up to a week in the fridge or 6 months in the freezer.
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
